results.title: Top 10 Most Mind-Blowing Scientific Discoveries of the 21st Century
results.summary: An overview of ten scientific breakthroughs, including black hole imaging, gene editing (CRISPR), Higgs boson discovery, human genome mapping, water on Mars, gravitational waves, mRNA vaccines, AI deep learning, exoplanet discoveries, and quantum computing. While impressive, the article lacks a faith-based perspective and fails to acknowledge God as the ultimate creator and source of knowledge. Readers should consider the ethical implications of technologies like CRISPR and AI in light of biblical teachings on the sanctity of life and the nature of humanity. "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom" (Proverbs 9:10).

results.title: 8 Changes in Modern Medicine That Patients Were Never Told About
results.summary: This article discusses shifts in modern medicine, including increased computer use by doctors, the rise of virtual care, private equity ownership of medical practices, facility fees, AI decision-making, automated insurance denials, medical data sales, and reliance on nurse practitioners. It warns that patients are often unaware of these changes, which can affect their healthcare and finances, advocating for transparency. This aligns poorly with biblical principles of honesty and stewardship. "A false balance is abomination to the Lord: but a just weight is his delight." (Proverbs 11:1) Readers should research and seek godly counsel.

results.title: Biopharma Market Set to Expand, Hitting USD 1356.6 Billion by 2034
results.summary: The global biopharma market is projected to reach USD 1,356.6 billion by 2034, driven by increasing demand for advanced therapies. The report highlights the growth of biologics, immunomodulators, and personalized treatments, particularly in oncology. While advancements in medicine are beneficial, true healing and hope come through faith in Jesus Christ, who offers eternal life. "But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed" (Isaiah 53:5, KJV).
